thread.title_full: Aurora woman injured during charity motorcycle run - Aurora Beacon-News

author: Erika Wurst
title: Aurora woman injured during charity motorcycle run Aurora Beacon-News
text:
An Aurora woman was severely injured in a motorcycle crash Sunday afternoon while participating in a charity motorcycle ride.
Sara Nickence, 43, was riding as a passenger on a motorcycle driven by Curtis Dalton, 46, of Warrenville, around 12:45 p.m. when the crash occurred, according to Kane County Sheriff's Lt. Patrick Gengler.
Deputies said the pair was part of a group of motorcyclists participating in a charity ride sponsored by the motorcycle riders rights advocacy group A.B.A.T.E. of Illinois.
Crash reports indicate that as Dalton and Nickence approached the intersection of Main Street and Green Road in unincorporated Blackberry Township, Dalton swerved his 2000 Yamaha motorcycle in an attempt to avoid a helmet that had fallen off of another rider.
Dalton ended up crashing the bike, and both he and Nickence were severely injured, Gengler said.
Nickence was taken to Delnor Hospital in Geneva for treatment. Dalton was airlifted to Advocate Good Samaritan Hospital in Downers Grove. Gengler said their condition is unknown.
Main Street was closed for about two hours while the crash was investigated. Deputies said no tickets have been issued.
Gengler could not confirm if Dalton or Nickence were wearing helmets.
